ygData.messageBody:
What a weekend! I went from 6th to 9th level! Hot dam!
I left Grobb and Innothule Swamp at 6th level and went
to Neriak. Shortly after I got there, I went to the
troll armor merchant and bought a full set of leather
armor.
After zoning to the forrest I still had my full set of
netted armor and a couple of woven items that I didn't
sell. I was in a really good mood so I ramdomly chose a
DE necro and without a word gave her all the netted I
had. She came back with a "Why me? What do I owe you?"
I just said no reason, I know casters need all the help
they can get. She thanked me profusely and said my
kindness would someday be repaid. I chuckled and said
to help out others when able, and that would be enough.
I left to stomp skele into powder and thought nothing of
it. I made 7th that night.
The next day when I got on I got a tell from the Necro
above asking to group. ? /who. She made 6th from
<insert level here>. Kewl. I said sure. We then
proceeded to stomp skele and young kody all over
Necktulos(?) Forrest through 3/4 of my level 8 for
Saturday and Sunday.
Just as I /shout "Level 9! Hot dam!" I get a tell from
someone asking me to come to the EC side of the zone
border. Out of curiosity I went. I had been saving many
DE a$$ since I got there, so what the heck.
After I zone, I get a hail and my trade window pops up.
? Then I see a FS2H sword and 8pp appear. I hit trade.
I had been using a rusty Halberd for a while. This was
awesome! I had been looking for a FS2H weapon all
weekend, but they were going for 15-20pp which I did not
have after buying my armor :(. The Highelf Wizard who
gave me the stuff said the DE Necro I helped called in a
favor to him and to use my new weapon wisely.
Two hours later I get a message from the female
necro. "Someone come visit you?" Yes. "Good. I hope
they treated you well." Hell yes they did!

New Thread
I was in Neriak when I hit 9th, and the DE guild would
not train me cause I play a troll. grrr. I went back to
Grobb and trained my magic abilities and my 1H Slash to
keep it up a bit. Then I bought all the 1st Rank
spells. All righty then! kewl. I zone to the swamp and
cast my first pet. NOT!!!!
"Insufficiant mana to cast this spell." WTF!!! Try
again. Same thing. Mana cost: 40. Hmmm. Dam. No big
deal really. Me not use one before. Is ok.
Next spell.
Invis to Undead. "Insufficiant mana to cast this spell."
Crap! Mana cost: 40.
Great. The spell that makes a SK visible as a SK (pet) I
am too stupid (Int of 62) to cast! And the spell that
will keep annoying green skele from attacking me I can't
cast either.
Using a mana calculator from the net I found out I have
a 14 mana pool. Increasing Int by 2 points I think was a
waste of points. Why? Using a mana calculator this is
what I found out.
Level Int:60 Int:70 Int:80
9 14 16 18
10 28 32 36
11 42 48 54
16 112 128 144
22 196 224 252
24 224 256 288

You get 1 point more base mana for every 5 points you
increase Int by. Each level you add the base mana to
your curret total. So, my advice to you all is not to
buy Int only items. Get Int (+5 minimum if you didn't
increase int at the start) AND mana increasing items.
Jaded Electrum Bracers: Mana +10, HP +10 and AC +2 each
bracer. Keep them on you but not equiped when battling
as you need the AC more. Equip them only when casting.
Unless the AC reduction doesn't bother you. :)
I do not know what other types of items are out there
that can help mana pool and not lose AC.
Anyone on this list that does please let me know. :)

--
Cronik
Servant of Thule the Pain Bringer
9th Season Troll SK
